Package game.modes

Class AutomaticMode

java.lang.Object
game.modes.Simulation
game.modes.AutomaticMode
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimulationI
public class AutomaticMode
extends Simulation
The AutomaticMode class represents a simulation mode where the game is automatically executed without user interaction. The primary purpose of this class is to handle automated decision-making, simulate player's movement, and manage the flow of the game based on predefined rules and strategies. AutomaticMode extends the Simulation class and overrides core methods to implement the specific logic needed for autonomous game operation.

    Constructs a new AutomaticMode instance to simulate the gameplay autonomously.

  • Constructor Details

    • AutomaticMode

      public AutomaticMode​(Mission missionImpl, Player player, Report report)
      Constructs a new AutomaticMode instance to simulate the gameplay autonomously.
      Parameters:
      missionImpl - the Mission object representing the mission details, including its objectives, enemies, items, and the battlefield.
      player - the Player object representing the player participating in the mission.
      report - the Report object used to record events, player movements, and outcomes during the simulation.

  • Method Details

    • game

      public void game() throws ElementNotFoundException, EmptyCollectionException
      Executes the main game logic for the automatic simulation mode. This method initializes the simulation, displays the starting information, updates the player's position, logs the entry point in the report, and proceeds with the game flow.
      Specified by:
      game in interface SimulationI
      Specified by:
      game in class Simulation
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if a required simulation element, such as the entry point or target, cannot be located.
      EmptyCollectionException - if the underlying collection used during game flow is found to be empty.

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer() throws ElementNotFoundException
      Moves the player to the next room in the simulation following the optimal path toward the current objective. This method calculates the shortest path between the player's current position and the next objective, updates the player's position, logs the movement, and checks the mission's state to determine whether the game is over.
      Specified by:
      movePlayer in interface SimulationI
      Specified by:
      movePlayer in class Simulation
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if the necessary pathfinding elements, such as the player's position or the next objective room, are not found.
